tldr: The author describes a method to isolate secretin, a hormone responsible for stimulating pancreatic juice secretion, from the duodenal mucosa. Secretin is a polypeptide and is soluble in water and dilute alkali. It has no influence on blood sugar levels and is excreted in bile after intravenous injection of large doses. The hormone also stimulates bile secretion and diminishes urine secretion.
